properties.areaDesc: Wyandot; Sandusky; Lucas; Wood; Crawford; Ottawa; Hancock; Seneca; Erie; Marion; Huron
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued January 11 at 4:31AM EST until January 11 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland OH
properties.description:
...Flooding Possible Through Saturday Evening...

.Many areas will see a break in precipitation this morning. As low
pressure reaches Northwest Ohio later this morning, rain will fill
back in and become steady across the Toledo area and extreme
northwest Ohio. Rain will expand eastward through the afternoon
and may be heavy at times, especially if thunderstorms develop.
The risk for flooding will increase today where higher rainfall
rates causing rain to run off into area waterways. Rises are
expected on area rivers and flooding may begin on some by tonight.
Some drainage systems may also become overwhelmed with flooding of
ditches, fields, and some roadways. If training of thunderstorms
occurs later today, a risk of flash flooding is also possible.

The Flood Watch continues for

* Portions of north central Ohio and northwest Ohio, including
the following areas, in north central Ohio, Crawford, Erie,
Huron, and Marion. In northwest Ohio, Hancock, Lucas, Ottawa,
Sandusky, Seneca, Wood, and Wyandot.

* Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is expected through this
evening.

* Rain will settle back south into extreme Northwest Ohio later
this morning and expand eastward through the afternoon. Rain
will be heavy at times this afternoon and evening.

* Scattered thunderstorms are possible Saturday afternoon and evening.
Some training of storms is possible which could lead to a risk
of flash flooding.

* The risk for flooding will be elevated, particularly in poor
drainage areas, near creeks, streams and ditches, and in urban
areas. Minor to moderate river flooding could develop this
weekend.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch is issued when there is a potential for flooding.
Monitor the forecast and remain alert for possible flood
warnings. Those in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to
take action should a flood warning be issued or if flooding
develops.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING
